rows.Title: CP Crash observed during CP stress test
rows.Problem: Turn ON the Phone > Run CP stress script > Observe. Actual Result: Kernel Panic Observed. Expected result: CP Crash should not be observed.
rows.Summarized Problem: CP crash occurs during stress test, leading to kernel panic.
rows.Severity Reason: CP crash causes system kernel panic, preventing normal operation.

rows.Title: CP Crash observed during CP stress test
rows.Problem:
Pre condition : SIM1: Airtel
                   DUT: SM-F761BE_SWA [352845440000562]
                   S/W version: AYD3/AYD3/AYD3

CP Stress Script name: CP Stress script 2025_03

Occurrence process:
Turn ON the Phone > Run CP stress script > Observe

Actual Result:
CP Crash Observed.
[ 1943.124899] [6: cbd: 1098] Kernel panic - not syncing: CP Crash : CP Crash by CP - UMTS: N/A
[ 1943.124899] [6: cbd: 1098] D-Abort(L3OT):DomainFault

Expected result: 
CP Crash should not be observed.

Note:
RDX, Dumpstate, Act logs attached.
rows.Summarized Problem: CP crash occurs during stress test, violating expected stability.
rows.Severity Reason: Crash during core process leads to system instability and failure to function.

rows.Title: VoNR toggle button is not showing in Network menu for Jio/Airtel.
rows.Problem: Go to settings > Connections > Mobile Network > Observe. VoNR toggle button is not available for Jio or Airtel. Expected result: VoNR toggle button should be available under Network menu.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoNR toggle button is missing in Network menu for Jio and Airtel.
rows.Severity Reason: Feature missing in core network settings prevents user from enabling VoNR on supported networks.

rows.Title: Data icon shows 4G while Device upper layer Indicator set 1
rows.Problem: SIM1: Airtel. Device in idle state until 4G data icon displays. Dial *#0011# to check. Data icon shows 4G while upper layer indicator is set to 1. Expected: when indicator is 1, data icon should show 4G. Upper layer indicator 1 should show 4G data in use.
rows.Summarized Problem: Data icon shows 4G when upper layer indicator is set to 1, violating expected behavior for 5G data indication.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue blocks correct 5G data indication under test conditions, causing misrepresentation of network status.

rows.Title: Unable to retrive the Call screen from Notification panel.
rows.Problem: Make MO/MT Call > tap in Home button > tap on the Call screen icon from top right corner > Observe. Unable to retrive the Call screen from Notification panel. Expected result: Call screen should get retrieved when tap on the Call icon.
rows.Summarized Problem: Call screen fails to retrieve from notification panel when tapping the call icon.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs always and blocks call screen access, but does not cause system crash or data loss.

rows.Title: System UI ANR occur
rows.Problem: Idle > drag Quick Plane > expand > edit icon > observe. Actual Result: SystemUI ANR occur. Expected result: Quick planel should work properly without any error
rows.Summarized Problem: System UI ANR occurs when interacting with Quick Plane feature
rows.Severity Reason: ANR occurs during normal usage, affecting feature functionality

rows.Title: Unable to turn on JIO Esim
rows.Problem: Pre condition : DUT: SM-F761BE_SWA [352845440001230] S/W version: AYD3/AYD3/AYD3. Occurrence process: Idle > Add JIO esim > esim configured > settings > SIM manager > Esim ON > Turn on eSIM > select "Turn ON" > Observe. Actual Result: "Couldn't connect with SIM. Try again later" pop up occur when we turn on Esim. Expected result: Esim should be configured and work properly without any error.
rows.Summarized Problem: Esim fails to turn on and shows connection error despite being configured.
rows.Severity Reason: Always occurs during Esim setup, blocks proper eSIM usage but does not crash system.

rows.Title: Wifi auto delatch & re-latch observed
rows.Problem: Connect DUT1 with DUT2 hotspot, enable Wifi Calling, keep device idle. Sometimes, Wifi auto delatches and re-latches. Expected: no auto delatch.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wifi automatically delatches and re-latches during idle state, violating expected behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: Intermittent issue affects Wifi calling stability during idle state.

rows.Title: DUT remains in Emergency Calls only state post Panic Call
rows.Problem: Precondition: SIM1: Airtel. Process: 1. Make a Panic Call by pressing power button 3 times > wait > observe. 2. Do Flight MODE ON/OFF > observe. Status: DUT unable to connect to Emergency Number; falls back to 2G and Emergency Call only state during call establishment; stays in Emergency Call screen for long time; unable to re-latch to NW after call termination; latches to NW after Flight mode ON/OFF. Expected: DUT should connect to Emergency number; should not stay in Emergency Call screen for long; should latch to NW post Emergency call ends.
rows.Summarized Problem: DUT fails to connect to emergency number and remains in emergency call state after panic call, unable to re-latch to network post-call.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue prevents normal emergency call functionality and network reconnection after call ends, but does not cause system crash or data loss.

rows.Title: DUT fall back to 2G NW when receive the MT Call
rows.Problem: Both DUTs connect to a Hotspot. VoWifi enabled with Wi-Fi preferred. Make MT Call (VoLTE/ViLTE) to DUT1 from DUT2. DUT1 takes longer to get call, then falls back to 2G NW. Everything works fine when Wi-Fi is off. Expected: DUT should get MT Call on Wi-Fi and VoWifi/ViWifi call should establish without CSFB.
rows.Summarized Problem: DUT falls back to 2G network during MT VoLTE call when VoWifi is enabled, despite expected Wi-Fi call establishment.
rows.Severity Reason: Issue occurs during key functionality under normal conditions, causing call fallback but does not crash or block full system usage.
